assessmentItem.title: Which of the following is NOT an ethical concern raised by Laud Humphreys’ study of homosexual behavior in public restrooms?

prompt.span: Which of the following is NOT an ethical concern raised by Laud Humphreys’ study of homosexual behavior in public restrooms?

simpleChoice.span: Humphreys deceived his subjects by offering to be watchqueen as if he were a member of the community.
Humphreys invaded the privacy of his subjects by looking up their license plates and identifying them.
Humphreys deceived his subjects by conducting a follow-up interview with his subjects while concealing his identity.
Humphreys completed the research in a public area where subjects had no expectation of privacy.
Humphreys did not identify himself as a researcher during the study.
